46:40 Caption: Suso (AC Milan) fires in an effort from the free kick from some 20 metres. His strike is very inaccurate and ends in row Z.
46:50 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
46:59 Caption: We have seen an attractive offensive game so far and the fans have nothing to complain about. The away side are dominant and dictating the tempo of the game, mainly because of their higher activity and more accurate passing. Both sides have adopted a tactic known as kick and rush football.

Second Half:

49:43 Caption: Gianluigi Donnarumma (AC Milan) leaps high near the penalty spot and gets a header in from the free kick. The attempt goes down towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save. It was a difficult header and it's always tough to put the ball inside the net from positions like that.
50:22 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
50:59 Caption: The fans must be pleased with the show they have seen on the pitch today. There was no chance to get bored as the game was very attractive. Let's hope the players won't lose their passion and determination in the future matches. We saw a very balanced game over the 90 minutes. Long balls and crosses were the main weapons of both teams.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
AC Milan faced Napoli in a tightly contested Serie A match that ended in a 2-1 victory for the visitors. From the opening whistle, the game was filled with intensity and dramatic moments, providing fans with an enthralling display of football.

The match kicked off with AC Milan taking control of the ball, looking to assert their dominance early on. However, it took less than half a minute for the ball to go out of play, leading to a Napoli throw-in. This sequence of throw-ins and balls going out of play continued for the first few minutes as both teams adjusted their strategies.

Napoli began to find their rhythm and produced the first significant action of the match at the five-minute mark. A well-orchestrated play saw them execute a controlled attack that culminated in a shot on target. This effort resulted in the opening goal of the match, setting the tone for Napoli's attacking prowess. AC Milan, taken aback by the early goal, kicked off once again at the center but soon lost possession.

Less than three minutes after the opening goal, Napoli struck again. Demonstrating precise offensive movement and efficiency, they bypassed Milan's defense and found the back of the net for the second time. This double strike within the first eight minutes left AC Milan reeling and desperately trying to regain their composure.

Milan tried to respond quickly but found it difficult to break through Napoli's disciplined defense. Winger Suso managed to deliver a cross into the box around the ten-minute mark, but Milan's efforts were thwarted by the alert opposition defense, which cleared the ball to safety. Another attempt to maintain possession by Milan was hindered when Dries Mertens received a yellow card for simulation—a rare dive that did not escape the referee's attention.

Napoli maintained their defensive stance and ensured that AC Milan's attempts at goal were met with resilient clearances. Around the 14-minute mark, a brief concern arose for Napoli when Jose Callejon appeared to be struggling after picking up a knock. However, to the relief of Napoli fans, Callejon quickly shook it off and resumed play.

Emotions started to boil over, leading to multiple fouls. Davide Calabria of AC Milan received a yellow card for a tough tackle at the 21-minute mark. Shortly thereafter, another Milan player, Jose Sosa, was booked for his foul play, showing the rising tension on the pitch. Napoli, however, weren’t immune to disciplinary actions either. Ivan Strinic of Napoli also saw yellow for a rough tackle a few minutes later.

Despite the mounting pressure and frequent interruptions, AC Milan showed signs of fightback. It was at the 36-minute mark when their persistence paid off. Juraj Kucka managed to convert a chance inside the box, reducing the deficit to 2-1. This goal revitalized Milan and instigated renewed energy among the players and fans alike.

Just before halftime, Lorenzo Tonelli of Napoli received a yellow card for a harsh tackle, adding to the list of cautioned players in an increasingly physical encounter. As the first half drew to a close, both teams had displayed moments of skill interspersed with bouts of rugged play. The halftime score stood at 2-1 in favor of Napoli, but AC Milan was far from out of the contest.

The second half began with Napoli kicking off and continuing from where they left off—defending their lead while also probing for any opportunities to extend it. Within the opening minutes, Mario Pasalic of AC Milan narrowly missed a chance to level the score, his header glancing off the post. This close call set the stage for an action-packed second half.

Milan continued to press forward, earning corner kicks and creating opportunities, but their efforts were met with strong defensive resolve from Napoli. One notable moment saw Jose Sosa collect a rebound and fire a low shot, only for Napoli’s goalkeeper Pepe Reina to make a decisive save.

The match’s physicality persisted as Gustavo Gomez of Milan received a yellow card for a rash tackle early in the half. Napoli responded with an opportunity of their own when Lorenzo Insigne’s free kick narrowly missed the target, sailing just over the crossbar. 

As the clock ticked on, AC Milan's Gianluigi Donnarumma made a formidable save in goal to deny Dries Mertens, who had managed to breach the defense once again. AC Milan kept searching for the elusive equalizer, creating several opportunities, but were consistently repelled by Napoli’s defense and the ever-reliable Pepe Reina.

Substitutions began to play a role as fresh legs were introduced to influence the game. Napoli’s manager decided to replace Jorginho with Amadou Diawara, while AC Milan brought on Gianluca Lapadula for Carlos Bacca in hopes of revitalizing their attack. Midway through the second half, both teams continued to make tactical changes.

Napoli's Lorenzo Insigne once again demonstrated his individual talent, weaving through Milan's defense only to see his effort narrowly miss the target. This was quickly followed by another save from Donnarumma, keeping Milan’s hopes alive.

As the match entered its final stages, Napoli made more substitutions, with Marek Hamsik making way for another player, in an attempt to maintain their lead. AC Milan also made changes, bringing on Andrea Bertolacci and M'Baye Niang to add creativity and energy to their pursuit of an equalizer.

Despite their best efforts, Milan’s push was curtailed by well-organized defensive plays and timely interventions by Napoli. Each attempt was met with resilience and strategic clearances. A series of corners was executed by Milan, but none managed to breach the Napoli defense.

Napoli’s discipline extended to the end, with even a late offside call against Gianluca Lapadula quelling Milan’s last-ditch efforts. As full-time approached, the tension was palpable. Fans from both sides held their breaths as Milan sought to capitalize on any lapse in Napoli’s defense.

Ultimately, as the referee blew the final whistle, Napoli emerged victorious with a 2-1 win over AC Milan. The match had been a rollercoaster of emotions—defined by early goals, relentless attacks, physical altercations, and tactical maneuvers. Both teams exhibited passion and determination, making it a memorable contest for all who witnessed it.

In summary, the game was characterized by Napoli's early dominance, unwavering defensive fortitude, and AC Milan’s valiant yet ultimately unsuccessful attempts to overturn the deficit. The clash showcased the beautiful and often harsh reality of football—a game of opportunities, missed chances, and moments of brilliance. The fans left the stadium with memories of an electrifying match, each side hopeful for better outcomes in the future.
